channel.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
channel.description:
http://belon.gs/
"[i]Ever lost anything important? Yeah, well, so have we and it's getting tiresome to always be buying new phones, iPads, jackets, watches, what-have-you... So we built Belon.gs – to make it easier for the things inevitably lost to find back to their owner.
It's simple: You just tag your most important things with a little discreet sticker, and [s]when[/s] if that thing gets lost, the finder will likely see the sticker and get back to you. Oh, and did we mention it's free to get started?[/i]"
We launced open beta earlier this week and now I wanted to introduce belon.gs to you guys aswell. Feedback, comments, questions and conversation about belon.gs is much appreciated.

item.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
item.dc:creator: @Algas Algas
item.description:
@Algas wrote:

[quote=“daiki, post:50, topic:446028”]It’s a nice idea. Hope it carries on.

Now I wonder if I saw Algas at the Assembly Summer 2012 event, while I visited the belon.gs promo-stand. Thanks for the potato chips! :P[/quote]

I wasn’t there. But you did saw my colleagues there. We still have dozens of bags of chips here at the office.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mopman:

its even shittier if you sell it, because then the poor fuck that buys the phone is getting a phone that will be bricked a few days after they pay for it. so you fuck over two people

well in that case the buyer can report the seller for selling stolen goods

but it’s shitty as well because the buyer isn’t likely to get a refund

item.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’m fairly sure both of those examples are illegal in most countries

just because you lose an item doesn’t mean you lose ownership of said possession, and taking an item you find without intent to return it or to hand it in to the authorities is still theft

Read full topic
item.source: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore

item.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:45, topic:446028”]I wouldn’t say /allowed/ as that to me implies an entitlement, but it is a lot better than declaring it yours as soon as you find it.

zachera recently did this, someone left their phone in a library by accident, he picked it up, wiped it instantly and took the sim out, thus stopping them from recovering it, and then sold it.[/quote]
I have a friend who’s done that too, he found a Galaxy S4 (is that what the newest ones called? it’s the one that’s been released most recently). He found it at the gym, took the sim card out and used the hard reset tool on Galaxy (it’s something like hold the power + volume up button) and then wiped the firmware on it when he got home, and sold it.

Read full topic

[quote]would never contemplate keeping a found phone!!!

I don’t know why that is hard to believe.[/quote]

item.source: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore

item.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

tL:

You mean like calling a friend/family member in their contacts list? Or just holding on to it till someone rings it so you can tell them where they can pick it up?

I can’t speak on behalf of other people, but I have found a phone before, and believe it or not I did try to return it.

I couldn’t get into the contact list because the phone was passcoded, and I waited for 5 days and no one rang it. After the 5th day the SIM became “inactive”, so I just handed it into police. I have no idea what came about from it, and if it was ever returned. But I also think, if you find a phone, and no one rings it/it’s passcoded/you have a fair attempt at returning it, after a week you should be able to keep it.

I’m not sure about other places, but afaik the general rule here, is if you find a chunk of a cash and hand it in, if noone claims it for 5 days it’s yours to keep. Not quite the same as phones, sure, but the principals still the same IMO.

ps I realize at this forum someones opinion is serious business, and ofcourse everyone here is morally correct and would never contemplate keeping a found phone!!!

Read full topic
item.source: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore

item.title: Belon.gs - Never lose your stuff anymore
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:35, topic:446028”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=548887.msg4077008#msg4077008 date=1344944853]
Pretty sure if I find an iPhone/any other sort of decent phone, as far as I am concerned/care, finders keepers
[/quote]

AUSTRALIANS[/quote]
Country founded by criminals… and you wonder why it’s considered accepted to keep a phone l0l

ps: I probably would return the phone, for some reward. Maybe it’s just my personal beliefs. I probably would be different had a lot of my shit not been jacked in the past. But, if someone loses their phone and there’s not an easy way to return it/reward, forget it.

Read full topic
